parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains "CMF11240003" at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda material, as CMF numbers are used for campaign finance reporting in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Sebastian Tiberiu Pop as a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for the PNCR (Partidul Național Conservator Român).  This directly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience beyond personal communication.  The use of hashtags further amplifies this reach, targeting a broader public. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's primary objective is to promote Sebastian Tiberiu Pop's candidacy.  It encourages listeners to engage with his podcast, implicitly aiming to increase support and votes. The call to action "Pe 1 decembrie, să arătăm că vocea noastră contează!" directly encourages voting. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post mentions a podcast, the content itself is promotional in nature, not journalistic. It lacks the objectivity and balanced reporting expected of journalistic work. The focus is on promoting the candidate and his views, not providing neutral information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured campaign message promoting a candidate and his party's platform. The mention of contesting electoral violations by USR is also a political statement aimed at influencing voters.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1522939945077241</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria of electoral propaganda as defined by LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, Art 36 (7). It refers to a specific candidate (Sebastian Tiberiu Pop), is used during the electoral campaign period (as indicated by the end date), has a clear electoral objective (promoting the candidate), and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion. The post's content and targeting clearly aim to influence voters' choices in the upcoming elections.  The only potential argument against it being electoral propaganda would be if the electoral campaign period had officially ended before the post's publication date. However, given the provided information, this does not seem to be the case.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Sebastian Tiberiu Pop</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNCR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1522939945077241) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatura sa la Camera Deputaților din partea PNCR,  conținând un mesaj explicit de susținere a candidaturii sale și îndemn la vot,  precum și menționarea unui număr CMF (CMF11240003), fapt ce constituie propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale. Postarea, cu o cheltuială de 100-199 RON, a generat între 6.000 și 7.000 de impresii, ajungând la o estimare de 100.000 - 500.000 de persoane, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului.  Informațiile de contact ale advertiserului sunt disponibile: contact@sebastiantiberiupop.ro și +40760256257.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
